results.title: The Midfield player with Trevor Brooking
results.creator_credit: Ray Marshall, Terry Ryan and Opix Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Focus on Soccer”.
England midfield man, Trevor Brooking, one of the Football League’s most stylish players describes the importance of the midfield role. He stresses that midfield players must possess all-round ability.

results.title: The Middle path
results.creator_credit: Alan Bateman, Geoffrey Barnes and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Journey into Thailand”.
Keith Adam presents this program which offers a visit to the small market town of Chom Thong which provides a glimpse of life in a Buddhist monastery. It shows how the monastery and the monks play a vital part in the day-to-day life of the town.

results.title: The Middle East: crossroads of three continents
results.brief_description: The scarcity of rainfall and water supply, the significance of being an international crossroad and the importance of rich oil deposits are three key ideas developed in relation to the countries of the Middle East. Their need for water and its effect on their economy is illustrated. The region is considered as a crossroads of peoples, historic cultures and trade. Three-quarters of the world’s reserves of oil are found here; this valuable product has had an important effect on relations of the Middle East with the rest of the world.

results.title: The Middle East
results.creator_credit: William L. Claiborne, International Film Foundation and Julien Bryan
results.brief_description: Presents the Middle East during the late 1950”s and the various problems it was facing at that time: Christianity and Mohammedans, the nomadic Bedouin and the effect of changes; water, locust plagues and primitive farming methods; peasants and absentee landlords; disease, malnutrition and illiteracy. In contrast there was also a growing modern metropolis, and an emerging middle class education, the oil industry and the Aswan Dam. All this resulting in internal tensions and an intense growing nationalism.

results.title: The Middle East
results.brief_description: Discusses the religious and historical background of the lands of the Middle East. Describes the way of life of a peasant. Surveys the agricultural resources and rich oil deposits of the Middle East.

results.title: The Middle ages: a wanderers guide to life and letters
results.creator_credit: Helen Jean Secondari, John H Secondari Productions and Piers Jessop
results.brief_description: Describes the atmosphere of the Middle Ages through enactment of excerpts from the literature of the period. Scenes are performed from the morality play “Everyman” and from Chaucer’s “Canterbury Tales”; the passionate concerns of youth speak through the verses of Dante and other poets of the age.

results.title: The Middle Ages
results.creator_credit: John Dooley and Polonius Film Services
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “An Outline History of Europe”.
History of the Middle Ages from Charlemagne examined through art, monasteries, agriculture and invasions. Illustrated by 15th century miniatures, the film gives a good background to European history, literature and art.

results.title: The Microscopy of opaque objects
results.creator_credit: Alex Strasser, Realist Films and Denys Parsons
results.brief_description: Materials such as plastics, leather, metals and textiles are opaque and must therefore be illuminated from above, Various methods of illumination are discussed; the direct method for very low-power work; the use of the simple vertical illuminator; the built-in vertical illuminator and the catoptric lens. The methods of operation are also explained.

results.title: The Microscope
results.creator_credit: John Taylor, Realist Films and Alex Strasser
results.brief_description: This film is designed for upper secondary and tertiary students of biology, medicine etc. Its purpose is to encourage the efficient and careful use of microscopes. The parts of the microscope, the correct way to set it up and the routine of procedure for high-power work are explained.

results.title: The Microphone
results.brief_description: A demonstration of the structure, and the functioning, of both the primitive and the improved types of carbon and ribbon microphones, as well as an analysis of the ribbon microphone and its use in a film studio.
